meanings.definition: The state of being dissipated or dispersed.
meanings.sent1: The dissipatedness of the clouds after the storm was a sign that the rain had passed.
meanings.sent2: The dissipatedness of the smoke made it hard to pinpoint the source of the fire.
meanings.sent3: The dissipatedness of the confetti after the celebration left colorful specks all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: The dissipatedness of the crowd after the concert was like watching a river flow in different directions.
meanings.sent5: The dissipatedness of the scent of fresh flowers filled the room with a fleeting fragrance.

meanings.definition: The quality of being wasteful or extravagant.
meanings.sent1: Her dissipatedness with money often left her struggling to make ends meet.
meanings.sent2: The dissipatedness of resources in the company led to budget cuts and layoffs.
meanings.sent3: His dissipatedness with snacks always resulted in an empty pantry by the end of the week.
meanings.sent4: The dissipatedness of her energy on trivial matters left her exhausted for the important tasks.
meanings.sent5: The dissipatedness of water during the drought made every drop precious.

meanings.definition: The act of indulging in excessive pleasure or vice.
meanings.sent1: His dissipatedness in eating sweets led to cavities and weight gain.
meanings.sent2: The dissipatedness of her partying lifestyle eventually took a toll on her health.
meanings.sent3: Their dissipatedness in watching TV shows all day made them miss out on outdoor adventures.
meanings.sent4: The dissipatedness of his gambling habits drained his savings and caused family strife.
meanings.sent5: The dissipatedness of her shopping sprees left her with a mountain of debt.
